data.title: 2004 Duffy Duffy Flybridge Downeast Oxford, Maryland
data.meta_description: 2004 Duffy Flybridge 37 Sport Cruiser   Altantic Boat Company has been building beautiful semi-custom yachts and work boats in New England since 1982.  This timeless Spencer Lincoln designed Duffy 37 has been highly customized by the builder and her experienced owners.    Altantic worked closely with Infinity and ...
data.text:
Walk Through

Walk Through

Starting forward is the private owners cabin, featuring a large v-berth with drawer storage underneath. His and hers hanging lockers, and additional drawers to port and starboard. Moving aft to starboard is a large head with Corian counters, mirrored storage vanity, Vacuflush head, and a stainless steel sink and faucet,. Opposite to port is a massive separate shower, equal in size to the head. Walking aft, up two steps gains access to the salon, galley, and lower helm area. There are heavy sliding doors to port and starboard and a teak hinged door leading to the cockpit. The lower helm offers two adjustable Stidd chairs to port and starboard. Moving aft you enter the main salon area with an L- shaped dinette (convertible to double sized bed) with solid teak table to starboard, and a galley to port. The Galley is comfortable and well equipped with plenty of refrigeration and freezer capacity.

Entering the cockpit from the main teak doorway, there is a ice maker to port and storage locker. The teak cockpit coaming is finished with Awl-wood, with a hinged tuna door in the transom. A solid teak swim platform is mounted to the stern, with underwater lights below.

A stainless steel ladder w/ King Starboard steps leads to the fly-bridge above. The fly-bridge features two more Stidd chairs, and an L-shapes settee. There is a mast with assorted electronic components and flag halyards. A blue Sunbrella bimini provides plenty of shade, and can be folded and stored when not needed.

Additional Information

Electronics

Lower Helm:

New Electronics installed (2018)

Garmin GPSmap sxv

Garmin GMR18 Radar on Mast

Raymarine ST6001 Hydraulic Autopilot

Icom IC-M602 VHF

Fusion Stereo w/ Klipsch speakers throughout vessel

Klipsch speakers throughout vessel

ACR Remote spotlight

Twin Volvo Penta Displays for engine monitoring and fuel consumption

Engine Guages

ACR Globalfix EPIRB with mount in cockpit

Upper Helm:

Repeater Garmin GPSmap 7612

Garmin GMR 18 Radar on Mast

Raymarine ST6001 Hydraulic Autopilot

Icom IC-M602 VHF

Klipsch speakers throughout vessel

ACR Remote spotlight

Twin Volvo Penta Displays for engine monitoring and fuel consumption

Galley

One of the most unique features of this custom Duffy is the modern galley up design. The galley is located immediately to port and shares space with the main salon. With a ton of refrigerator and freezer capacity, there is plenty of room for provisions.

Nova Cool 7.5 Cu. Ft. Combination refrigerator/ freezer 12/24V

Nova Cool Top loading freezer 2.5 Cu. Ft. 12/24V

Kenyon EuroKara smooth top two burner electric range

U-Line Ice Maker located in cockpit

Panasonic microwave

Custom slide out storage with toaster and coffee maker

Deep stainless steel sink

Single lever faucet w/ soap dispenser

Under counter storage

Toaster and coffee maker

Electrical

Perhaps one of the most notable features of Infinity and Beyond is it's electrical system. Each Duffy is built on a semi custom basis. The owners of Infinity were very well versed in high end marine electrical equipment. The electrical system has several redundancies built in.

6KW Northern Lights Genset with 60 hours. (New 2021 )

(1) Group 27 Generator Starting Battery

(4) Group 24 maintenance free Batteries

Magnum Charger/Inverter

Custom Mastervolt A/C and D/C breaker panels

30A and 50A shorepower inlets

(3) Abyss Underwater LED lights

24V 75Amp Alternator

Mechanical

Volvo Penta TAMD 75 P-A Diesel. 480HP @ 2600 RPM (2105 hours)

Volvo Penta single lever electronic controls

ZF 2F260-1 Transmission

2" shaft w/ 5 blade bronze propeller

Dripless Shaft Seal- Las-Drop

Volvo Penta electronic displays w/ trip computers and fuel economy

Northern Lights 6KW Genset (60 hours)

Sidepower Bow Thruster w/ twin controls

(2) MarineAire reverse cycle heating and air Units

Kahlenburg Bros pneumatic air horn w/ compressor and tank (Commercial grade)

Reverso oil change pump for main and genset

Racor 75900MAX dual cartridge fuel filter system

Fire Boy extinguisher for engine room

Windshield wipers with controller

Plumbing

Vacuflush head and holding tank system

Diaphram pump for overboard discharge

Shurflo Smart Sensor fresh water pump w/ Filter

12 Gallon 120V water heater w/ engine heat exchanger

Raw water washdown for cockpit and bow

Fresh water shower for cockpit

Tank Watch holding tank monitor

Water level guage

Hull and Deck

Solid hand laid fiberglass hull

Vinylester skin coat on hull

Full keel with skeg rudder and shoe

Hull Painted with White Awl Grip (2021)

Top Sides painted with White Awl Grip (2021)

Access doors on port, starboard and aft

Hinged stern door

Transom Door

Teak swim platform, finished with Awgrip Awlwood

Teak hand rails and trim finished with Awlgrip Awlwood

Cockpit nonskid refinished 4/2017

Simpson Lawrence Windlass w/ controls at bow and helms

35 lb CQR anchor with 200' chain and swivel

Bottom painted and Zincs 6/2023

Stainless steel cleats and chocks

Stainless steel bow rails

Additional Equipment

Spare bow thruster propeller and zincs

Assortment of fenders and dock lines

Stern anchor w/ rode and storage bag

Anchor bridle

Assortment of Chart Kits

Owner Updates

10/17 Marine Propulsion

Repacked rudder packing box, Troubleshooting temp gage. Repainted bottom/zincs. Seatalk Autopilot Head. New VHF. New Pye-Barker Fire Boy System.

$6,547.47

3/19/18. Signal Marine

Full electronics outfit. Installed 2 Garmin MFD’s, radar, WX/Sirius, TV antenna, networking, and stereo system. Removed all previous navigation equipment and all wiring cables, networking, and terminal blocks. Installed GMR18 on mast with custom mounting plate. Installed GMX53 in mast. Installed 15” open air antenna on mast. Installed Garmin network hub. Installed Garmin 7612 and 7612sxv, integrated existing transducer with junction. Installed isolated fuse box for all networking items. Installed Fusion RA70n stereo.

$17,777.00

5/4/18 Signal Marine

Installed mechanical water temperature gage and oil pressure gage at flybridge. Oil change.

$2,477.67

6/15/18 Atlantic Marine

Replaced forward HVAC unit with new turbo Domatic DTU6 115V HVAC unit.

$3,018.52

10/10/18. Campbell’s Boatyards

Repaired and replaced underwater lights.

$1,943.78

Replaced forward hatch and trim.

$1,097.50

10/14/19 Marine Propulsion

Removed transducer and glass over hole. Installed to new transducer Garmin GT50M-HP.

$2,769.99

6/29/20. Replaced all rubber gaskets on portholes and replaced 4 plastic ports.

1/28/21 to 3/22. Deltaville Boatyard

Replaced Mastervolt System except for transformer, circuit panel, and one communication module. New Northern Light Generator 6KW and exhaust system, all inverters, chargers, batteries, battery cables, all charger cables, switches, and wiring. Replaced exhaust elbow at turbocharger and exhaust hose. Re-bonded all through-hull fittings and seacocks. Repaired port fuel tank with epoxy and resealed supply and intake hose port. Added new extra vent for both fuel tanks. Painted entire exterior topsides and hull. Sealed port window at galley.

$99,759.00

6/22. Signal Marine

Cleaned up electrical after painting. Installed bow-thruster module lever at flybridge, repaired windless switches, repaired WX antenna, repaired and replaced TV antenna and coax. Repaired underwater light wiring.

$1,763.34

7/22 Harbor Master

Rebuilt vacu flush toilet.

$835.72

12/2/22

Flybridge 3 piece Sunbrella clear zippered wind shield.

$1,839.50

12/6/22.

Replaced main alternator 24V/75 amp

$596.00

12/5/22. Sweetgrass Diesel

Trip to St. Simon Island, replaced wet rubber hose 2”, air filter, and repaired exhaust leak at exhaust elbow.

$457.00

2/3/23 Gary Woods Marine Inc.

Replaced turbocharger with Volvo 2139 Turbo (2 year warranty)..

$6,266.50

Heat Exchanger and After Cooler Done - August 2023
